quotes.quote: If you carry your cross joyfully, it will carry you.
It is much easier to wear a cross than to bear a cross.
Look at the cross and you will know what one soul means to Jesus.
Without the cross we have a meaningless and powerless Christianity.
The cross is the only ladder high enough to touch Heaven's threshold.
Only on the cross do you have a totally holy God and a totally loving God.
The cross is where God forgave his children without lowering his standards.
The Cross is the Word through which God has responded to evil in the world.
The cross is the place where, and the means by which, God loved us to the uttermost.
The cross is God's way of taking away all of our accusations, excuses, and arguments.
The cross is proof of both the immense love of God and the profound wickedness of sin.
For those who live by faith, the cross is a treasure more valuable than gold and precious stones.
The cross means there is no shipwreck without hope; there is no dark without dawn; nor storm without haven.
The cross is the surest, truest and deepest window on the very heart and character of the living and loving God.
The cross alone is our theology.
The cross is the ladder to heaven.
The cross cannot be defeated for it is defeat.
Bear the Cross cheerfully and it will bear you.
While the world changes, the cross stands firm.
The cross is steady while the world is turning.
The cross is the gift God gives to his friends.
All crosses are easier to carry when we keep moving.
The cross is God taking on flesh and blood and saying, Me too.
Taking up my cross means a life voluntarily surrendered to God.
The cross grants us position, the Holy Spirit gives us experience.
The Cross is the way to Paradise, but only when it is borne willingly.
The cross of Christ is the true ground and chief cause of Christian hope.
The Cross will be for us as it was for Christ: proof of the greatest love.
Whoever does not seek the cross of Christ doesn't seek the glory of Christ.
A cross without offense to the world is a cross without power in the world.
The cross is a precious treasure to be kept secret, lest we be robbed of it.
Usually one gets a heavier cross when one attempts to get rid of an old one.
Apart from the cross, there is no other ladder by which we may get to heaven.
Out of the cross comes the resurrection. Out of weakness comes real strength.
The cross means suffering. Suffering's meaning is to be learned through the cross.
Jesus' Cross shows the full force of evil, but also the full power of God's mercy.
There is no cross, big or small, in our life which the Lord does not share with us.
The cross of Jesus Christ represents the intersection of God's love and God's holiness.
We need men of the cross, with the message of the cross, bearing the marks of the cross.
Go to the cross of Christ, all you that want to be delivered from the power of selfishness.
The Cross is not responsible for God's love; rather it was His love that conceived the Cross.
The Cross is the central event in time and eternity, and the answer to all the problems of both.
The cross shows us the seriousness of our sin-but it also shows us the immeasurable love of God.
Because of the Cross, God can be both just towards sin and yet mercifully justifying to sinners.
To believe Christ's cross to be a friend, as he himself is a friend, is also a special act of faith.
The cross is offensive because it directly confronts the evils which dominate so much of this world.
The way of the Cross is not easy, yet it is the tuneful, the rhythmic, the beautiful, the lovely way.
The Cross of Christ is the crux of history. Without the Cross, history cannot be defined or corrected.
The cross reminds us that there is no true love without suffering, there is no gift of life without pain.
The cross stands high above the opinions of men and to that cross all opinions must come at last for judgment.
